title: Understanding Records
text: In a database, a record is a collection of related data items, often referred to as fields, that are treated as a single unit. Each record typically represents a single entity or item.

title: Fields in a Record
text: Fields are individual pieces of data within a record. Each field holds a specific type of information, such as a name, date, or number.

title: Tables and Records
text: A table in a database is made up of multiple records. Each row in a table represents a record, and each column represents a field.

title: Identifying a Record
text: Which of the following best describes a record in a database?
